Journal Story: Arrived at Atlanta airport and took the tram to the end of the line where I was picked up by ???. He drove me to the grocery store then to the Lodge at Amicalola Falls. After checking in and lunch, I hiked a mile downhill on a side trail. I registered at the visitor center as the 285th thru hiker and hiked the first mile of the approach trail which includes the 600+ steps up the falls. After a buffet dinner at the lodge, I packed up my gear and went to bed.

I hiked the remaining 7.8 miles of the approach trail. Someone offered me a ride to Springer Mountain but I declined. Saw my first trail magic; a bag of clean city clothes. Passed ???, an older hiker with a 45 pound pack and a duffle bag in one hand. He had never set up a tent before but I later learned that Tailgate helped him when he got to Springer. I hiked past the shelter at Springer and set up my hammock on the side of the trail in the rain.

Hiked to Hawk Mountain Shelter. Met Good Life while hiking and really enjoyed his company. Lots of people here. I thought it would be good to hammock away from the shelter. After I was all set up I noticed I was right by the privy. I didn't socialize and pretty much kept to myself. It felt like the first days of school.

Small talk with a few folks on the trail including Hopscotch. Everyone was going to Gooch. When I got there it was packed and I set up my hammock pretty far down the hill from the shelter. I took my food up to the shelter to cook but the table was packed so I sat on the ground and ate. Afterwards I made an effort to talk with everyone I could. I met Pilgrim, Darwin, Legs, and many others. I used the bear box for all my food.
